Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin SLG1 (natural AMPs; bacteriocin, bacteria, prokaryotes; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against Gram+ B. subtilis CICC 10034 or 10071 or 10002 (MIC 8 ug/ml),  B. cereus CICC 2155 or 21290 (MIC 8 ug/ml), B. megaterium CICC 10448 or 10024 (MIC 8 ug/ml), M. luteus CICC 10209 or 21460 (MIC 4 ug/ml), B. thermosphacta CICC 10509 (MIC 16 ug/ml), C. butyricum CICC 10350 or 20036 or 20763 (MIC4 ug/ml), S. aureus CICC 10201 or 10001 or 10306 or 10786 or 10384 (MIC 8-16 ug/ml), L. innocua CICC 10416 or  10417 or  10297 (MIC 4 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes CICC 21529 or 21532 or 21574 (MIC 4 ug/ml), Gram- coli CICC 10302 or 10300 or CGMCC 3373 (MIC 8 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa CICC 21636 or 10419 or 20240 (MIC 8 ug/ml), E. cloacae CICC 21539 or 10450 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. paratyphi beta CICC 10437 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. enterica subsp. enterica CGMCC 1.10754 or 1.10603 (MIC 32 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans CICC 1965 or 32380 (MIC 32 ug/ml), and S. cerevisiae CICC 1002 or 1012 or 1006 (MIC 32 ug/ml). The original was redundant and replaced 2/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Pei J, Li X, Han H, Tao Y. 2018
Literature Information.Title: Purification and characterization of plantaricin SLG1, a novel bacteriocin produced by Lb. plantarum isolated from yak cheese
